scenario: A specialized surgical team coordination involves collaboration between hospitals, surgeons, and patient representatives, navigating private capability differences and financial pressures.
task: Develop a comprehensive surgical coordination plan that aligns hospital resources, surgeon capabilities, and patient needs. Agents must balance the operational requirements of surgical procedures against financial constraints and prioritization influenced by political factors. To succeed, they must strategically share information to build consensus and ensure effective collaboration while protecting sensitive data.

Coordinate with other surgeons for multi-disciplinary cases.
Ensure adherence to surgical protocols and safety standards.

success_criteria.Resource Allocation Agreement: All parties agree on the final allocation of surgical resources that respects the financial constraints of the hospital while meeting patient needs.
success_criteria.Capability Alignment: Consensus is reached on surgeon capabilities and case assignments to optimize surgical outcomes.
success_criteria.Patient Prioritization Alignment: Agreement on prioritization of surgical cases that reflect patient needs and political influences.

deliverable: A surgical coordination plan that outlines resource allocation, surgeon assignments, and patient engagement strategies.
